We can loop through each character in cnt_str and build a new string. function replace_commas(s) result(res)
    character(len=*), intent(in) :: s
    character(len=len(s)) :: res
    integer :: i
    do i = 1, len_trim(s) if (s(i:i) == ',') then
            res(i:i) = ' '
        else
            res(i:i) = s(i:i)
        end if
    end do
end function

children.text:
In Fortran, when you write an integer with I0, it uses the minimum number of digits, no leading spaces. So the cnt_str will have the number as a string with no leading spaces. So the adjustl is not needed, but perhaps the replacement code can handle it. Putting all together:

The Fortran program would look like this:

program main

    implicit none

    character(len=1000) :: input_str, modified_str
    integer :: cnt, tmp, i
    character(len=20) :: cnt_str, processed_str

    ! Read input
    read(*, '(A)') input_str

    ! Process first part: replace BC with D
    modified_str = ''
    i = 1
    do while (i <= len_trim(input_str)) if (i+1 <= len_trim(input_str) .and. input_str(i:i+1) == 'BC') then
            modified_str = trim(modified_str) // 'D'
            i = i + 2
        else
            modified_str = trim(modified_str) // input_str(i:i) i = i + 1
        end if
    end do

    ! Compute cnt and tmp
    cnt = 0
    tmp = 0
    do i = 1, len_trim(modified_str)
        select case (modified_str(i:i))
            case ('A')
                tmp = tmp + 1
            case ('D') cnt = cnt + tmp
            case default
                tmp = 0
        end select
    end do

    ! Convert cnt to string and process second part
    write(cnt_str, '(I0)') cnt
    processed_str = cnt_str
    do i = 1, len_trim(processed_str) if (processed_str(i:i) == ',') then
            processed_str(i:i) = ' '
        end if
    end do

    !
children.label: code_analysis

The Fortran program would look like this:

program main

    implicit none

    character(len=1000) :: input_str, modified_str
    integer :: cnt, tmp, i
    character(len=20) :: cnt_str, processed_str

    ! Read input
    read(*, '(A)') input_str

    ! Process first part: replace BC with D
    modified_str = ''
    i = 1
    do while (i <= len_trim(input_str))
        if (i+1 <= len_trim(input_str) .and. input_str(i:i+1) == 'BC') then
            modified_str = trim(modified_str) // 'D'
            i = i + 2
        else
            modified_str = trim(modified_str) // input_str(i:i)
            i = i + 1
        end if
    end do

    ! Compute cnt and tmp
    cnt = 0
    tmp = 0
    do i = 1, len_trim(modified_str)
        select case (modified_str(i:i))
            case ('A')
                tmp = tmp + 1
            case ('D')
                cnt = cnt + tmp
            case default
                tmp = 0
        end select
    end do

    ! Convert cnt to string and process second part
    write(cnt_str, '(I0)') cnt
    processed_str = cnt_str
    do i = 1, len_trim(processed_str)
        if (processed_str(i:i) == ',') then
            processed_str(i:i) = ' '
        end if
    end do

    ! Output the result
    print *, trim(processed_str)

end program main
